build_chart.description: Quility Term Plus uses a unisex height/weight chart (imperial units) to assign one of four rate classes: Preferred Plus, Preferred, Standard Plus, or Standard. Half of any intentional weight loss over the past 12 months may be added back to current weight when determining final rate class.

tables.title: Maximum Weight in Pounds (Quility Term Plus)
tables.measurement_unit: imperial (height in feet/inches, weight in pounds)

laboratory_requirements.description: No laboratory tests, bloodwork, or paramedical exams are required—Quility Term Plus is fully simplified issue (aside from height/weight build chart and a short health questionnaire).

risk_classes.description: Quility Term Plus assigns one of four simplified issue risk classes—Preferred Plus, Preferred, Standard Plus, and Standard—based on build chart placement and accepted medical/non-medical criteria. There are no table ratings.

classes.name: Preferred Plus
criteria: Height/weight within Preferred Plus column of build chart (see Part I)
No disqualifying health conditions or lifestyle factors in Part III (e.g., no major autoimmune complications, no uncontrolled hypertension, no active substance abuse)
Age 18–65, face amount within income-multiple limits
No tobacco use (including marijuana if frequent or synthetic)

classes.name: Preferred
criteria: Height/weight within Preferred column of build chart
Accepted medical conditions from Part II (e.g., stable asthma, controlled diabetes without insulin, treated skin cancer)
No disqualifying conditions or lifestyles in Part III
Age 18–65, face amount within income-multiple limits

classes.name: Standard Plus
criteria: Height/weight within Standard Plus column of build chart
More moderate accepted conditions (e.g., atrial fibrillation > 2 years, treated ulcerative colitis, mild MS without mobility issues)
No disqualifying conditions or lifestyles in Part III
Age 18–65, face amount within income-multiple limits

classes.name: Standard
criteria: Height/weight within Standard column of build chart
Any accepted conditions from Part II that are stable but may require ongoing follow-up (e.g., controlled hypertension on two meds, diabetes with A1C < 8, mild depression)
No disqualifying components in Part III (e.g., recent cancer, recent major surgery, severe COPD)
Age 18–65, face amount within income-multiple limits

tobacco_guidelines.description: Any tobacco or nicotine use (cigarettes, cigars, vaping, CBD/synthetic) within the past 12 months routes an applicant to the Standard class. Occasional marijuana use (under specified frequency) may still qualify for non-tobacco rates; synthetic marijuana or heavy recreational use is declined.

classifications.classification: Eligible for Preferred Plus, Preferred, or Standard Plus, depending on build and health history.
Routed to Standard class (no Preferred or Preferred Plus available).
Considered non-tobacco if under frequency limits (see Part II).

financial_underwriting.description: Income verification is not collected at application, but face amounts are constrained by income multiples. Underwriting relies on self-reported income to ensure suitability of coverage amount relative to need.

special_considerations.description: Certain medical conditions and lifestyle factors automatically decline Quility Term Plus or require alternative coverage. See Part III for details.

factors.guideline: Any autoimmune disorder requiring crutches/wheelchair → Decline.
No treatment needed for ≥ 2 years, normal colonoscopy within 2 years, stable weight and no complications to be acceptable; otherwise → Decline.
Any diagnosis or active treatment in past 10 years (except non-melanoma skin cancers) → Decline; basal/squamous exceptions per Part II.

Any history of peripheral vascular disease, congenital heart disorder, pulmonary fibrosis, recent atrial fibrillation (< 2 years), COPD with more than minimal symptoms, oxygen use, or severe heart murmurs/pacemaker/defibrillator → Decline.
Parkinson's, ALS, Alzheimer's, any dementia ever → Decline; recent seizures (< 3 months) or full evaluation incomplete → Possible decline.
Any substance abuse or treatment in past 10 years → Decline; single or multiple suicide attempts in past 10 years → Decline.
Current pregnancy with complications (e.g., pre-eclampsia, gestational diabetes) → Decline.
Any felony conviction or probation/parole within 10 years → Decline.
Multiple DUI/DWI or reckless/negligent driving → Decline; more than four moving violations in past 3 years → Decline or manual review.
Motor racing, private aviation, scuba > 100 ft, or other extreme sports within 2 years → Decline.
Any pending diagnostic tests or recommended surgeries not completed → Decline.
